greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Numbers k such that sigma(k) == 4 (mod k).
comment: a(16) <= 2251799645913088. Every number of the form 2^(j-1)*(2^j - 5), where 2^j - 5 is prime, is a term. - _Jon E. Schoenfield_, Jun 02 2019
mathematica: Join[{1}, Select[Range[9000000], Mod[DivisorSigma[1, #], #]==4 &]] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Mar 20 2011 *)
program: (PARI) is(n)=sigma(n)%n==4 || n==1 \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Mar 09 2014
results.author: _Dan Hoey_
ext: Additional term (a(11)) from _Harvey P. Dale_, Mar 20 2011
Initial term 1 inserted and a(13)-a(15) from _Donovan Johnson_, Mar 01 2012
Typo in Mathematica program fixed by _Vincenzo Librandi_, Mar 11 2014
